articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Angelo Amante
articles.description: Group of Seven (G7) leaders start their annual summit on Thursday looking to double down on support for Ukraine in its war with Russia and offer a united face in confronting China's political and economic ambitions.
articles.title: Troubled G7 leaders focus on Ukraine war, China in Italian summit

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced deeper into the western area of Rafah, amid one of the worst nights of bombardment from air, ground, and sea, forcing many families to flee their homes and tents under darkness, residents said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli forces thrust deeper into Rafah as diplomacy falters

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court rejected a bid by anti-abortion groups and doctors to restrict access to the abortion pill, handing a victory on Thursday to President Joe Biden's administration in its efforts to preserve broad access to the drug.
articles.title: US Supreme Court preserves access to abortion pill mifepristone

articles.author: John O'Donnell
articles.description: Ukraine needs more air defences within weeks to allow repairs to the half of its power infrastructure destroyed by Russian attacks, or it will not be able to meet demand in the winter, the country's energy minister told Reuters.
articles.title: Ukraine says without more air cover there won't be enough power for winter

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Barbara Erling, David Latona
articles.description: From Germany and France to Poland and Spain, the far-right made inroads into the youth vote in key states in this EU election - as a generation that has grown up amid constant crises seeks new answers and follows politicians fluent in TikTok and YouTube.
articles.title: How the far-right gained traction with Europe's youth

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin, Abinaya V, Greg Roumeliotis
articles.description: Tesla shareholders are voting to approve a $56 billion pay package for Elon Musk and to move the electric vehicle maker's legal home to Texas, the CEO said on social media on Wednesday, adding that passage was by wide margins.
articles.title: Musk says Tesla shareholders voting yes for his $56 billion pay package

articles.author: Helen Coster, Ted Hesson
articles.description: One late afternoon in mid-May, a half dozen Hispanic day laborers were paid $20 each to parade in front of the White House on camera, holding signs with slogans like "I Love Biden" and "I Need Work Permit for My Family."
articles.title: Insight: Pro-Trump influencers fire up fears of migrant 'invasion' ahead of U.S. election

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy signed a 10-year bilateral security agreement on Thursday aimed at bolstering Ukraine's defense against Russian invaders.
articles.title: US, Ukraine ink 10-year defense agreement billed as NATO precursor

articles.author: Giulia Paravicini, Steve Stecklow
articles.description: An estimated 756,000 people in Sudan could face catastrophic food shortages by September, according to a preliminary projection used by United Nations agencies and aid groups to determine whether to officially declare a famine.
articles.title: Exclusive: Famine watchdog projects 756,000 Sudanese face starvation in coming months

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou, Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: A man with dual Russian-German nationality has been detained in St Petersburg, according to news reports and people who know him, with some Russian independent media reporting that he is suspected of treason.
articles.title: Russian-German lawyer detained in St Petersburg, media say on suspicion of treason
